summary: This was so perfect. Everything about the scene: the music  the editing  the acting the direction the montage of every moment of...
body:
This was so perfect. Everything about the scene:

the music 

the editing 

the acting

the direction

the montage of every moment of elu

lucas almost getting hit by a car and not caring about it.

T n’es plus seul.

the priest’s speech

EVERYTHING!

am i going to watch it again

blog.name: altereliott
blog.title: minuto per minuto.
blog.description: annie | 20 | crushing hard on maxence danet fauvel | skam, skamit & skamfr | martino rametta, eliott demaury & lucas lallemant need protection | @altereliott on AO3

body:
Vendredi 20h40

Eliott did not know when he last cried that much.

It was dark, pitch black in the middle of the night here in his shelter. Here where he kissed Lucas for the first time. Their dance in the dark, light flashing through the deep night.

Eliott let out a sob and buried his head in his arms, knees drawn up to his chest.

He should‘ve told Lucas about him being bipolar. He should‘ve told him from the beginning. But he was so afraid that this whole thing with Lucas would end before it even started. He lost his heart to the boy who was afraid of the dark. But now he lost the boy too.

He hasn‘t checked his phone since days. He didn’t care about the messages, the phone calls. He didn’t want to talk with anyone, he just wanted to be alone. His phone started to ring. Again and again and again.

Something inside him was breaking. Eliott took out his smartphone and threw it at the wall across from him, a scream clawing its way through his throat. He watched his phone shattering, finally not needing to hear this stupid ringtone anymore.

Lucas deserved way better than… this. He would have an easier and happier life without Eliott. And everything Eliott wanted was for Lucas to be happy.

Tears were streaming down his face as every moment with Lucas flashed through his mind like his own little cinema show. Only that this was the truth - he really lived that perfect life with that perfect boy for some precious minutes, hours, days.

And now he had nothing. Nothing left to care about. Nothing left to live for.

“Eliott!”

He even imagined his voice now. Eliott pulled his hood over his head, resting his forehead against his drawn up knees. He heard the voice again. And again.

“Just… just stop. Please. Stop this. Make it stop.” Eliotts voice was barely audible, not even to him. Maybe he said it in his thoughts, not out loud. He was not sure. He was not sure of anything.

Suddenly a light was bursting through his darkness. Could it be…? Who would be at this place, at his shelter at this time?

“Eliott!”

And suddenly the light was directly on him. His heart stopped to beat for a second.

Not possible.

He didn‘t know I would be here.

How could he know?

More tears were streaming down his face. He felt so alone. He even imagined things which weren‘t there. He wanted to be alone. He wanted to be in his arms. He wanted to stop this thoughts. He wanted to…

Suddenly he felt warmth, a body right in front of him, someone breathing as if they had been running for quite a while now.

He wasn‘t imagining that. He couldn‘t imagine Lucas‘ scent that strong, couldn‘t imagine the feeling which rose inside him everytime Lucas was near him. His breathing picked up. Lucas was here. Here. To search for him. To find him. To safe him.

And then he felt his forehead against his own. He knew now that it was really him. That it was no ghost. That it was his Lucas. His mec. Eliott was shaking, slowly lifting his head, only to hear Lucas gasp as the other boy saw his tears. Eliott didn‘t want Lucas to see him like that and yet…

Lucas touched his chin, lifted his face, carefully stroking over his cheek.

“You‘re not alone.”

Eliotts heart was racing and he couldn‘t stop the tears, couldn‘t stop crying.

I‘m sorry, Lucas.

I‘m sorry.

I‘m sorry.

So many things he wanted to say to Lucas be he stayed silent. He just moved ever so slightly towards Lucas as if the light and his warmth would pull him out of the dark place of his mind.

And slowly, so, so slowly Eliott was opening his eyes, directly looking into the blue pools of Lucas‘ eyes. He tried to draw them once but he couldn‘t find the right color. He would never find the right color for the beauty of Lucas’ eyes.

“I’m here. You‘re not alone anymore,” Lucas whispered and looked into Eliotts eyes. Eliott felt like a weight had been lifted from his heart. Lucas was here. Here. With him. And that was enough for this very moment. The flashlight from Lucas smartphone illuminated his face. His beautiful face. Eliott still cried. Lucas eyes were full of tears too.

But in this very moment, with the light shinging on Lucas’ face and the tears in his eyes, Eliott saw an angel, pulling him out of the dark and into the light.

summary: You know what would of been good version of 5 fine frøkner for France is Ça plane pour moi. It's a Belgian song with nonsense...
question: You know what would of been good version of 5 fine frøkner for France is Ça plane pour moi. It's a Belgian song with nonsense lyrics and it doesn't make any sense.
answer:
Anon….I literally love that song. Like, I listen to it, unironically.

I’m genuinely sad that it wasn’t included in Skam France. It’s a crime, honestly.

A missed opportunity in my opinion.

tags: you can blame isi for this tbh
good luck with this pain bless
summary: Lucas 7281 gets hit by that car.  He’s still conscious when they load him up into the ambulance, the EMT’s doing all sorts of...
body:
Lucas 7281 gets hit by that car. 

He’s still conscious when they load him up into the ambulance, the EMT’s doing all sorts of tests on him. It feels like his thoughts are fading in and out of focus. He’s forgetting something.. something important.. 

It’s 3 minutes into the ambulance ride he remembers, and it takes another 5 minutes for him to get the EMTs to listen to him. He’s lucky they don’t just sedate him. 

As soon as Lucas knows Eliott will be found he feels how extensive his injuries really are. It’s enough to knock him out. 

Lucas wakes up groggy. He’s actually not feeling that bad. A little like everything around him is foggy. It doesn’t last long. He remembers the car, remembers the pain, remembers… Eliott! 

He wants to jump up, but is held back by wires and crashing noises and everything comes into too bright focus. A hospital. He’s in the hospital. He’s in a hospital bed. He grabs around him in search of the alarm box frantically. Eliott, they need to find- 

“Lucas, don’t move, you’re hurt,” Eliott’s voice brings him down from his panic. HIs- whatever Eliot is at this point, is sitting upright in the bed next to him. He looks pale and like he has just cried and Lucas wants to reach out, but the damn wires.

“You- Are you okay?” Lucas asks softly, because now he sees Eliott he also sees the bandages. Eliott doesn’t really answer, doesn’t really look at him. Lucas never thought it was possible for someone to look broken, but Eliot does.

“Eliott?” he whispers, his voice cracking. 

“I’m so sorry,” Eliott finally says, and it’s like the words take every bit of energy he had left with them. “I was asleep when they brought me here. I should- they should just bring me to another room." 

"No!” Lucas yells it out. It’s an accident, but it gets Eliott to actually look at him so what the hell. 

“No. I’m sorry. I should have found you. I should have-” He groans out of frustration. “I’m sorry I didn’t notice how bad you got. I’m sorry I-" 

"Lucas…”

Eliott somehow does manage to untangle himself from the endless net of wires. He gets up and takes a cautionary step towards Lucas. There’s hope there, but also fear. Eliott’s eyes flick to the door and then back to Lucas, and to the door again. A question he doesn’t dare speak. 

Lucas reaches out and Eliott crashes into him, quite literally taking his breath away. The car crash definitely left a mark. When Eliott hears his gasp of pain he moves away, but Lucas drags him right back. He grabs Eliott’s face between his hands and puts their foreheads together. 

“It’s okay. It’s all okay. We’re okay,” he whispers softly, unsure what else to say. There’s tears rolling down Eliott’s face again and he takes them away with his thumbs. “You’re not alone.”

As soon as Lucas knows Eliott will be found he feels how extensive his injuries really are. It’s enough to knock him out.

“Lucas, don’t move, you’re hurt,” Eliott’s voice brings him down from his panic. HIs- whatever Eliot is at this point, is sitting upright in the bed next to him. He looks pale and like he has just cried and Lucas wants to reach out, but the damn wires.

“You- Are you okay?” Lucas asks softly, because now he sees Eliott he also sees the bandages. Eliott doesn’t really answer, doesn’t really look at him. Lucas never thought it was possible for someone to look broken, but Eliot does.

“Eliott?” he whispers, his voice cracking. 

“I’m so sorry,” Eliott finally says, and it’s like the words take every bit of energy he had left with them. “I was asleep when they brought me here. I should- they should just bring me to another room." 

"No!” Lucas yells it out. It’s an accident, but it gets Eliott to actually look at him so what the hell. 

“No. I’m sorry. I should have found you. I should have-” He groans out of frustration. “I’m sorry I didn’t notice how bad you got. I’m sorry I-" 

"Lucas…”

Eliott somehow does manage to untangle himself from the endless net of wires. He gets up and takes a cautionary step towards Lucas. There’s hope there, but also fear. Eliott’s eyes flick to the door and then back to Lucas, and to the door again. A question he doesn’t dare speak. 

Lucas reaches out and Eliott crashes into him, quite literally taking his breath away. The car crash definitely left a mark. When Eliott hears his gasp of pain he moves away, but Lucas drags him right back. He grabs Eliott’s face between his hands and puts their foreheads together. 

“It’s okay. It’s all okay. We’re okay,” he whispers softly, unsure what else to say. There’s tears rolling down Eliott’s face again and he takes them away with his thumbs. “You’re not alone.”
trail.content:
Lucas 7281 gets hit by that car. 

He’s still conscious when they load him up into the ambulance, the EMT’s doing all sorts of tests on him. It feels like his thoughts are fading in and out of focus. He’s forgetting something.. something important.. 

It’s 3 minutes into the ambulance ride he remembers, and it takes another 5 minutes for him to get the EMTs to listen to him. He’s lucky they don’t just sedate him. 

As soon as Lucas knows Eliott will be found he feels how extensive his injuries really are. It’s enough to knock him out. 

Lucas wakes up groggy. He’s actually not feeling that bad. A little like everything around him is foggy. It doesn’t last long. He remembers the car, remembers the pain, remembers… Eliott! 

He wants to jump up, but is held back by wires and crashing noises and everything comes into too bright focus. A hospital. He’s in the hospital. He’s in a hospital bed. He grabs around him in search of the alarm box frantically. Eliott, they need to find- 

“Lucas, don’t move, you’re hurt,” Eliott’s voice brings him down from his panic. HIs- whatever Eliot is at this point, is sitting upright in the bed next to him. He looks pale and like he has just cried and Lucas wants to reach out, but the damn wires.

“You- Are you okay?” Lucas asks softly, because now he sees Eliott he also sees the bandages. Eliott doesn’t really answer, doesn’t really look at him. Lucas never thought it was possible for someone to look broken, but Eliot does.

“Eliott?” he whispers, his voice cracking. 

“I’m so sorry,” Eliott finally says, and it’s like the words take every bit of energy he had left with them. “I was asleep when they brought me here. I should- they should just bring me to another room." 

"No!” Lucas yells it out. It’s an accident, but it gets Eliott to actually look at him so what the hell. 

“No. I’m sorry. I should have found you. I should have-” He groans out of frustration. “I’m sorry I didn’t notice how bad you got. I’m sorry I-" 

"Lucas…”

Eliott somehow does manage to untangle himself from the endless net of wires. He gets up and takes a cautionary step towards Lucas. There’s hope there, but also fear. Eliott’s eyes flick to the door and then back to Lucas, and to the door again. A question he doesn’t dare speak. 

Lucas reaches out and Eliott crashes into him, quite literally taking his breath away. The car crash definitely left a mark. When Eliott hears his gasp of pain he moves away, but Lucas drags him right back. He grabs Eliott’s face between his hands and puts their foreheads together. 

“It’s okay. It’s all okay. We’re okay,” he whispers softly, unsure what else to say. There’s tears rolling down Eliott’s face again and he takes them away with his thumbs. “You’re not alone.”
trail.content_abstract:
Lucas 7281 gets hit by that car. 

He’s still conscious when they load him up into the ambulance, the EMT’s doing all sorts of tests on him. It feels like his thoughts are fading in and out of focus. He’s forgetting something.. something important.. 

It’s 3 minutes into the ambulance ride he remembers, and it takes another 5 minutes for him to get the EMTs to listen to him. He’s lucky they don’t just sedate him. 

As soon as Lucas knows Eliott will be found he feels how extensive his injuries really are. It’s enough to knock him out.

summary: Tbh I feel like if you were expecting an exact copy of OG then yeah the song choice might have been a bit destabilizing and it...
body:
Tbh I feel like if you were expecting an exact copy of OG then yeah the song choice might have been a bit destabilizing and it took me two seconds to get used to it as well? But it fit so well because they are two different pairings ?

O Helga Natt was blessed. It was peace, and a Christmas miracle. It was a rebirth, grace, incredibly subtle, hope winning over tragedy, life over death, love as healing. It was the perfect ending to Isak’s journey of self-discovery, slow and tender and hesitant, ending in courage and compassion. The deep sadness of Even reaching out hopelessly and them meeting in the middle. It was heartbreaking and sweet at the same time, finding Even like that, but he was found. A balm. So beautiful. Angels singing, snow falling, understanding at last. Perfect storytelling, harmony. Their happy ending.

T'es pas tout seul was frantic, intense, like Lucas and Eliott. It was about love stronger than fear, light reaching through to darkness. The music like a frenetic chorus in waves, a gospel, love is God, they’re each other’s sanctuary and holy place, Lucas remembering the truth of what they were and him being the only one who knows where to find Eliott, because he has seen his soul. Lucas making a conscious choice to be better than his asshole of a dad, and running, and almost getting hit by a car. Eliott lost in the dark, huddled like a wounded animal. Lucas putting all his fears and insecurities to the side. Something to go down in history, to remember for eternity, a prayer to call down the sun in the middle of the night.

Anyway, O helga natt is one of the best scenes in tv history and the fact that we are getting remakes of it that are also completely their own thing ? Extraordinary. That’s all.

summary: I think we're gonna get first the clip with Lucille and then the minute by minute but what Lucille is going to say???besides...
question: I think we're gonna get first the clip with Lucille and then the minute by minute but what Lucille is going to say???besides "I'm sorry for treating you like that" I mean they're gonna meet because they're gonna have a talk??
answer: I think they’re going to sit down and it’ll be awkward at first, but I think he’ll tell her that Eliott’s okay or that he’s sleeping or something. He’ll probably ask her for advice, in some way, and she’ll give him the minute by minute talk. I think she’ll apologize for what she said and tell him that she was just stressed or something and after that I’m assuming they’ll part ways, or it’ll cut to Lucas being back home with Eli ♡
